intro: Pteropsis blumei, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
